title: Plans for Varus ADC?
body:
Any plans for Varus in the future?

I hope you guys won't forget about Varus as the ADC in the botlane.
Varus his kit is really cool but it could use some change.


1. If Varus gets a kill or an assist, his attack speed passive (living vengeance) shows up and his bow starts to glow. What if timer of his passive only starts to run at the first auto attack. This would make Varus a great ADC for teamfight snowballing.
Most of the time when the passive activates on Varus, I couldn't use it because the timer is just a few seconds, not long enough to make good use out of it.

2. Mana % refund on popping 3 blight stacks.

3. Popping 3 blight stacks empowers the abilities on Varus. Bonus slow on E  ...% per stack

4. Popping blight stacks lowers the cooldown of his abilities.

5. Give Varus 600 range

These are just a few ideas.
But I hate to see Varus just being used as a Q spam machine.

replies.body: We've got a buff to Varus's passive coming shortly (probably hitting PBE tomorrow) intended to increase both power and satisfaction of auto attack builds. Numbers currently in testing are a 0.5 bonus AS ratio on champion kills/assists and a 0.25 bonus AS ratio on minion/monster kills. If you've got 60% bonus AS from items then for example the champion proc will give you 70% AS (40% base +30% ratio). Both buffs also have a standardized duration of 5s (versus 6s/3s).

Is this a nerf to caster Varus who doesn't build AS (and recently had the AS active removed from ghostblade witch is core on him )
What are your thoughts on Varus mid (or Manamune/leathality Varus bot?)

Probably won't be very relevant to caster Varus, can't see it nerfing those builds though (base is the same apart from the duration adjustments, scaling's additional to what was already there).

Not certain yet what impact the AD item changes have had on caster Varus. Gut reaction is some degree of nerf, mid lane's pretty messy though at present so not leaping to conclusions.

Heyo. I've been playing around with the new items for AD Caster Varus and I've noticed a big core issue.

- Youmuu's  and the other lethality items are still fine as a steroid for Varus' scaling AD. However the only real reason to grab them on him now is primarily to have increased movement speed for an escape. He still scales off during the mid - late stages, and the lethality over flat armour penetration in my opinion and experience make him less of a threat than he used to be. He still has early lane dominance during the early but his off-scaling is far more noticeable once the mid game starts picking up. I'd have to get into auto attack range to be a threat at all from mid- late game phases. The item changes have pretty much been a soft nerf to him and his mid game presence. Now obviously to experienced players with Varus it wouldn't be too hard to do well since you just have to sit back and hit Peircing Arrow. You'll still delete most ADC's in a couple of shots but that's to be expected. It's less of a threat to more HP / armoured champions than it used to be. Even when I'm hitting Q's at late game to gain a poke advantage the damage is still mitigated, even from a direct hit. Squishies will still get destroyed if they're hit, that's a given.  If anything Varus will become more of a Flex Pick for mid lane than before, primarily for his CC ult.

- I think the improved passive will definitely benefit auto-attack based builds. Combined with the incoming Guinsoo's change it might shift his power as a bot lane auto attacker.  GR, RH and BoRK might become his meta botlane build and probably improve his standing versus other ADCs. Varus has desperately needed a vast improvement to his passive and I'm pretty glad about it. I think it'll make him a bigger threat during laning for the botlane. His AA range could be improved, considering the Hitbox / AA range bug between him and Vayne, as she's capable of auto'ing him even though he still can't reach her, despite having a higher AA range.


This is coming primarily from a Varus ADC main. However I've played him in every lane and role (Yes that does include Jungle lmao. Surprisingly was alright once the jungle item was bought) and I've been playing Varus solidly for a straight year. I do look forward to this improvement to shift his power to benefit the style I primarily played him in.

Looking at the pbe there are already changes to tone down both vayne and twitch, tone down AP kog while trying to shift some of that midlane caster style power into his bot lane AA style pattern, and tweak up the long overdue kalista. Are there going to be any looks into the marksman who's been hit a bit harder this preseason like lucian who lost his pen build and took hits from fervor even when he is building crit because of it's weakened stacking with him (seems to be an issue of the passive not giving 2 stacks for the 2 auto's) or kindred who also took dual hits from the jungle being much less favorable for farming can collecting marks (longer camp spawn times and one of the potential first mark camps being raptors maul single target champs like kindred) and their best mastery fervor being changed to favor crit champs while kindred kit scales unquestionably best with attack speed and hardly with damage and basically not at all with crit.

We're happy supporting Varus as an AD caster. There have been a number of times though when auto attack builds have been pretty weak but caster builds strong, meaning it hasn't been appropriate to just generally buff Varus. We're adding something specific to those auto attack builds as a result to allow us to better support both styles.

I believe that the best way to show Varus's ADC Potential is to make something like that in Vayne's case back in the 5.22 patch:
Varus:

     Stats
        Base attack damage increased to 56 from 54.7. 
        Attack damage growth reduced to 2.19 from 2.41. 

    Blighted Quiver (W)
        New Effect: Now automatically detonates upon reaching 3 stacks of blight.
        Percentage changed to 8 / 9.5 / 11.25 / 13 / 16% of target's maximum health from 6 / 8.25 / 11.5 / 12.75 / 15%. (it's not true dmg so buying MR can ruin this dmg so having this 15-16% should not be considered as broken like in vayne's case)
        Passive magic damage to AAs reduced to 8 / 11 / 14 / 17 / 20 from 10 / 14 / 18 / 22 / 26.

That way you don't affect the full lethality Varus mid but you really emphasize his attack speed/crit based build, don't you think?
I don't believe these should be the numbers, you're riot you know better about numbers but something like that should be just fine for varus to be put back in the AS/Crit based ADCs while being played in the bot lane. (still valuable as a full AD mid laner)

His passive is so strange. He's slow and immobile, so most of his kit makes you want to not be near something, but his attack speed based passive makes you get way closer and need to follow an enemy. I love Varus, but his kit always felt all over the place to me.

I think it's supposed to be like that, same reason xerath gives you mana back on auto attack. It makes you risk getting closer than you would normally for a bigger payoff, but exposing you to counter play if you get caught

You can make the passive less significant, but be activated when you pop W stacks on enemies. It encourages him to attack first then use his spells.

Numbers out of my ass - 10% attack speed per W popped, up to 60%. Runaahs hurricane would be core item. Riot this is how you move a champion into an ADC position.
